fr.berger.enhancedlist.exceptions

Class InfiniteLoopException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • fr.berger.enhancedlist.exceptions.InfiniteLoopException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class InfiniteLoopException
extends java.lang.Exception
implements java.io.Serializable
    Exception to raise when a loop is infinite. This class extends from Exception, which means it has to be handle. To use this class, an instance of it must be created beforehand, and then use increment() method at the end of the loop. When the counter will reach the limit, the instance of this exception will be thrown. The default limit is 1'000, and can be changed with setLimit(long) method.
    Author:
    Valentin Berger
    See Also:
    Exception, Serialized Form
